newsitem.title: UK: Argentina bonds to be for $3.0 bln - London dealers.
newsitem.headline: Argentina bonds to be for $3.0 bln - London dealers.

text.p: Argentina's planned jumbo dollar global bonds could total as much as $3.0 billion, syndicate managers said on Tuesday.
The deals will be launched with five- and 15-year maturities, they said. The tranches would not necessarily be of equal sizes, with the final distribution depending on demand.
Last week, market talk centred on a $2.0 billion global bond at five- and 20-year maturities. These plans had now been changed, syndicate managers said.
"Argentina will issue a five- and 15-year bond for up to $3.0 billion, not five and 20 years as discussed last week," said a head of emerging market syndicate at a European bank.
"They are expected to launch the deal early next week."
A formal announcement from Argentina was expected soon, traders said. J.P. Morgan and Merrill Lynch were tipped as joint lead managers on the deals.
Mexico is due to issue a $1.0 billion 10-year global bond on Wednesday via Merrill Lynch and Salomon Brothers.
